meanings.definition: To treat with spite or malice
meanings.sent1: She was spiting her sister by hiding her favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: He was spiting his friend by spreading rumors about him.
meanings.sent3: The cat was spiting the dog by stealing its bed.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to be spiting the town with its relentless rain.
meanings.sent5: The villain was spiting the hero at every turn.

meanings.definition: An act of treating with spite or malice
meanings.sent1: Her spiting of others always led to conflicts.
meanings.sent2: The spiting of his classmates made him unpopular.
meanings.sent3: The spiting in the office was causing tension among colleagues.
meanings.sent4: The spiting in the story added a layer of drama.
meanings.sent5: The spiting in the movie made the audience dislike the character.

meanings.definition: A feeling of spite or malice
meanings.sent1: His spiting towards authority figures was evident in his rebellious behavior.
meanings.sent2: The spiting in her heart made her bitter towards others.
meanings.sent3: The spiting she felt towards her rival motivated her to work harder.
meanings.sent4: The spiting in the air was palpable during the argument.
meanings.sent5: The spiting in his eyes revealed his true feelings.
